Utterance: <sigh>
Welcome back! How has your week been?
It’s been a mixed bag, honestly. I went to a film event, but I felt really anxious.
It’s great that you took the step to attend! Can you share what made you feel anxious?
I struggled to talk to anyone. I felt like I was just standing there, watching.
That sounds frustrating. What do you think contributed to that feeling?
I think it’s just my shyness. I keep thinking no one will want to talk to me.
It’s easy to fall into that mindset. What would you tell a friend who felt that way?
I’d tell them that people are usually more open than they think.
Exactly! Sometimes we are our own harshest critics. How did you feel after the event?
I was disappointed in myself. I wanted to connect but didn’t know how.
It’s okay to feel that way. Remember, each experience is a learning opportunity. What could you try differently next time?
Maybe I could prepare a few conversation starters in advance.
That’s a fantastic idea! Having a few topics in mind can help ease anxiety.
I’ll work on that.
Great! Let’s talk about your emotions. Have you noticed any changes in how you’re feeling lately?
I’ve been more aware of my anxiety, but I still feel overwhelmed sometimes.
That awareness is a positive step. How do you typically cope when you feel overwhelmed?
I usually just try to distract myself with movies or music.
Those are valid coping mechanisms. Have you considered incorporating mindfulness or breathing exercises?
I’ve heard of those but haven’t tried them.
Mindfulness can help ground you in the present moment. Would you be open to trying a simple breathing exercise now?
Sure, I can do that.
Let’s take a deep breath in together... and out. Focus on your breath. How does that feel?
It’s calming. I like this.
It’s a great tool to have in your toolkit. You can use it whenever you feel anxious.
I’ll remember that.
Let’s talk about your family. You mentioned feeling closer to your dad. How has that relationship evolved?
It’s good! We’ve been talking more regularly since I moved.
That’s wonderful to hear. Having supportive relationships can be a great source of comfort.
Yeah, it really helps.
Are there any family dynamics that you still find challenging?
I still struggle with how my mom reacts to things. She tends to be critical.
That can be tough. Have you considered setting boundaries with her?
I haven’t really thought about that.
Setting boundaries can help protect your emotional well-being. It’s okay to express your needs.
I’ll think about it.
As we wrap up, let’s set a goal for next week. How about practicing that breathing exercise daily?
I can do that.
Fantastic! And perhaps write down a few conversation starters for your next outing?
Yes, I’ll work on that too.
You’re making great strides. I’m proud of you!
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Have a great week, and I look forward to hearing about your progress.
Bye!
Goodbye!
